description: An Amazon Web Services Verified Access endpoint is where you define your application along with an optional endpoint-level access policy.

parameters.name: VerifiedAccessGroupId
parameters.description: The ID of the Verified Access group to associate the endpoint with.

parameters.name: EndpointType
parameters.description: The type of Verified Access endpoint to create.

parameters.name: SecurityGroupIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the security groups to associate with the Verified Access endpoint. Required if AttachmentType is set to vpc. (string) ---

parameters.name: LoadBalancerOptions
parameters.description: The load balancer details. This parameter is required if the endpoint type is load-balancer. Protocol (string) --- The IP protocol. Port (integer) --- The IP port number. LoadBalancerArn (string) --- The ARN of the load balancer. SubnetIds (list) --- The IDs of the subnets. You can specify only one subnet per Availability Zone. (string) --- PortRanges (list) --- The port ranges. (dict) --- Describes the port range for a Verified Access endpoint. FromPort (integer) --- The start of the port range. ToPort (integer) --- The end of the port range.

nested_params.name: Protocol
nested_params.description: The IP protocol.

nested_params.name: Port
nested_params.description: The IP port number.

nested_params.name: LoadBalancerArn
nested_params.description: The ARN of the load balancer.

nested_params.name: SubnetIds
nested_params.description: The IDs of the subnets. You can specify only one subnet per Availability Zone.

nested_params.name: PortRanges
nested_params.description: The port ranges.

nested_params.name: FromPort
nested_params.description: The start of the port range.

nested_params.name: ToPort
nested_params.description: The end of the port range.

parameters.name: NetworkInterfaceOptions
parameters.description: The network interface details. This parameter is required if the endpoint type is network-interface. NetworkInterfaceId (string) --- The ID of the network interface. Protocol (string) --- The IP protocol. Port (integer) --- The IP port number. PortRanges (list) --- The port ranges. (dict) --- Describes the port range for a Verified Access endpoint. FromPort (integer) --- The start of the port range. ToPort (integer) --- The end of the port range.

nested_params.name: NetworkInterfaceId
nested_params.description: The ID of the network interface.

nested_params.name: Protocol
nested_params.description: The IP protocol.

nested_params.name: Port
nested_params.description: The IP port number.

nested_params.name: PortRanges
nested_params.description: The port ranges.

nested_params.name: FromPort
nested_params.description: The start of the port range.

nested_params.name: ToPort
nested_params.description: The end of the port range.

parameters.name: TagSpecifications
parameters.description: The tags to assign to the Verified Access endpoint. (dict) --- The tags to apply to a resource when the resource is being created. When you specify a tag, you must specify the resource type to tag, otherwise the request will fail. ResourceType (string) --- The type of resource to tag on creation. Tags (list) --- The tags to apply to the resource. (dict) --- Describes a tag. Key (string) --- The key of the tag. Constraints: Tag keys are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 127 Unicode characters. May not begin with aws:. Value (string) --- The value of the tag. Constraints: Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 256 Unicode characters.

nested_params.name: ResourceType
nested_params.description: The type of resource to tag on creation.

nested_params.name: Tags
nested_params.description: The tags to apply to the resource.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The key of the tag. Constraints: Tag keys are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 127 Unicode characters. May not begin with aws:.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The value of the tag. Constraints: Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 256 Unicode characters.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: A unique, case-sensitive token that you provide to ensure idempotency of your modification request. For more information, see Ensuring idempotency. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: SseSpecification
parameters.description: The options for server side encryption. CustomerManagedKeyEnabled (boolean) --- Enable or disable the use of customer managed KMS keys for server side encryption. Valid values: True | False KmsKeyArn (string) --- The ARN of the KMS key.

nested_params.name: CustomerManagedKeyEnabled
nested_params.description: Enable or disable the use of customer managed KMS keys for server side encryption. Valid values: True | False.

nested_params.name: KmsKeyArn
nested_params.description: The ARN of the KMS key.

parameters.name: RdsOptions
parameters.description: The RDS details. This parameter is required if the endpoint type is rds. Protocol (string) --- The protocol. Port (integer) --- The port. RdsDbInstanceArn (string) --- The ARN of the RDS instance. RdsDbClusterArn (string) --- The ARN of the DB cluster. RdsDbProxyArn (string) --- The ARN of the RDS proxy. RdsEndpoint (string) --- The RDS endpoint. SubnetIds (list) --- The IDs of the subnets. You can specify only one subnet per Availability Zone. (string) ---

nested_params.description: The protocol.

nested_params.name: Port

nested_params.name: RdsDbClusterArn
nested_params.description: The ARN of the DB cluster.

nested_params.description: The ARN of the RDS proxy.

nested_params.name: RdsEndpoint
nested_params.description: The RDS endpoint.

nested_params.name: SubnetIds
nested_params.description: The IDs of the subnets. You can specify only one subnet per Availability Zone.

parameters.name: CidrOptions
parameters.description: The CIDR options. This parameter is required if the endpoint type is cidr. Protocol (string) --- The protocol. SubnetIds (list) --- The IDs of the subnets. (string) --- Cidr (string) --- The CIDR. PortRanges (list) --- The port ranges. (dict) --- Describes the port range for a Verified Access endpoint. FromPort (integer) --- The start of the port range. ToPort (integer) --- The end of the port range.

nested_items.name: VerifiedAccessEndpoint
nested_items.description: Details about the Verified Access endpoint.

nested_items.name: VerifiedAccessInstanceId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Amazon Web Services Verified Access instance.

nested_items.name: VerifiedAccessGroupId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Amazon Web Services Verified Access group.

nested_items.name: VerifiedAccessEndpointId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Amazon Web Services Verified Access endpoint.

nested_items.name: ApplicationDomain
nested_items.description: The DNS name for users to reach your application.

nested_items.name: EndpointType
nested_items.description: The type of Amazon Web Services Verified Access endpoint. Incoming application requests will be sent to an IP address, load balancer or a network interface depending on the endpoint type specified.

nested_items.name: AttachmentType
nested_items.description: The type of attachment used to provide connectivity between the Amazon Web Services Verified Access endpoint and the application.

nested_items.name: DomainCertificateArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of a public TLS/SSL certificate imported into or created with ACM.

nested_items.name: EndpointDomain
nested_items.description: A DNS name that is generated for the endpoint.

nested_items.name: DeviceValidationDomain
nested_items.description: Returned if endpoint has a device trust provider attached.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_items.description: The IDs of the security groups for the endpoint.
(string) ---

nested_items.description: The load balancer details if creating the Amazon Web Services Verified Access endpoint as ``load-balancer``type.
